chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: seq R
x: seq R

Goal:
(0 < size x)%nat -> (0 < size y)%nat -> last 0 x = head 0 y -> seq_step (x ++ behead y) = Rmax (seq_step x) (seq_step y)

Premises:
Notation seq := list
seq_step = fun s : seq R => foldr Rmax 0 (pairmap (fun x y : R => Rabs (y - x)) (head 0 s) (behead s)) : seq R -> R Argument scope is [seq_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Rmax = fun x y : R => if Rle_dec x y then y else x : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
head = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: _ => x end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
last = fun T : Type => fix last (x : T) (s : seq T) {struct s} : T := match s with | [::] => x | x' :: s' => last x' s' end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
behead = fun (T : Type) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => [::] | _ :: s' => s' end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
size = fun T : Type => fix size (s : seq T) : nat := match s with | [::] => 0%nat | _ :: s' => S (size s') end : forall T : Type, seq T -> nat Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
behead_rcons : forall (s : seq ?T) (t : ?T), (0 < size s)%nat -> behead (rcons s t) = rcons (behead s) t where ?T : [x : seq R y : seq R |- Type]
interval_finite_subdiv : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal), a <= b -> {l : seq R | head 0 l = a /\ last 0 l = b /\ (forall i : nat, (S i < size l)%nat -> nth 0 l i < nth 0 l (S i) <= nth 0 l i + eps)}
OmegaLemmas.OMEGA2 : forall x y : Z, (0 <= x)%Z -> (0 <= y)%Z -> (0 <= x + y)%Z
sorted_head : forall (s : seq R) (i : nat), sorted Rle s -> (i < size s)%nat -> forall x0 : R, head x0 s <= nth x0 s i
sorted_dec : forall (s : seq R) (x0 x : R), sorted Rle s -> head x0 s <= x <= last x0 s -> {i : nat | nth x0 s i <= x < nth x0 s (S i) /\ (S (S i) < size s)%nat} + {nth x0 s (size s - 2) <= x <= nth x0 s (size s - 1)}
sorted_last : forall (s : seq R) (i : nat), sorted Rle s -> (i < size s)%nat -> forall x0 : R, nth x0 s i <= last x0 s
Nat.lt_irrefl : forall x : nat, ~ (x < x)%nat
Rdiv_le_0_compat : forall r1 r2 : R, 0 <= r1 -> 0 < r2 -> 0 <= r1 / r2
seq_step_ge_0 : forall x : seq R, 0 <= seq_step x
headI : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (x : T), rcons s x = head x s :: behead (rcons s x)
Rmult_lt_compat_l : forall r r1 r2 : R, 0 < r -> r1 < r2 -> r * r1 < r * r2
nfloor_ex : forall x : R, 0 <= x -> {n : nat | INR n <= x < INR n + 1}
Nat.lt_0_succ : forall n : nat, (0 < S n)%nat
sorted_incr : forall (s : seq R) (i j : nat), sorted Rle s -> (i <= j)%nat -> (j < size s)%nat -> forall x0 : R, nth x0 s i <= nth x0 s j
size_rcons : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (x : T), size (rcons s x) = S (size s)
Rmult_max_distr_l : forall a b c : R, 0 <= a -> a * Rmax b c = Rmax (a * b) (a * c)
RmaxRmult : forall p q r : R, 0 <= r -> Rmax (r * p) (r * q) = r * Rmax p q
Rmax_mult : forall a b c : R, 0 <= c -> Rmax a b * c = Rmax (a * c) (b * c)
interval_finite_subdiv_between : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal) (Hab : a <= b), let l := proj1_sig (interval_finite_subdiv a b eps Hab) in forall i : nat, (i < size l)%nat -> a <= nth 0 l i <= b
Rlt_div_r : forall a b c : R, c > 0 -> a * c < b < -> a < b / c
last_cat : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s1 s2 : seq T), last x (s1 ++ s2) = last (last x s1) s2
last_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1) (x : T1), last (f x) [seq f i | i <- s] = f (last x s)
open_interval = fun a b x : R => a < x < b : R -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope R_scope]
nfloor : forall x : R, 0 <= x -> nat
last_cons : forall (T : Type) (x y : T) (s : seq T), last x (y :: s) = last y s
Zle_left : forall n m : Z, (n <= m)%Z -> (0 <= m + - n)%Z
OmegaLemmas.fast_Zopp_plus_distr : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (- x + - y)%Z -> P (- (x + y))%Z
adapted_couple = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (l lf : Rlist) => ordered_Rlist l /\ pos_Rl l 0 = Rmin a b /\ pos_Rl l (Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l)) = Rmax a b /\ Rlength l = S (Rlength lf) /\ (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l))%nat -> constant_D_eq f (open_interval (pos_Rl l i) (pos_Rl l (S i))) (pos_Rl lf i)) : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Rlist -> Rlist -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope _ _]
Zgt_left : forall n m : Z, (n > m)%Z -> (0 <= n + -1 + - m)%Z
size_cat : forall (T : Type) (s1 s2 : seq T), size (s1 ++ s2) = ssrnat.addn (size s1) (size s2)
